column2: RHODE ISLAND DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A few drinks after work before driving home:
column4: should be avoided unless you really need them.
column6: should be avoided because they impair your judgement.
column8: have no effect on your driving ability.
column10: are acceptable as far as they are part of your daily routine.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column8: Left turns are permitted
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 3. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column8: darker

column2: 4. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column8: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column10: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 5. Blind spots are:
column6: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that are easy to spot.
column8: areas of the road that cannot be seen even when looking into mirrors.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic must move only in the direction of the arrow
column8: Minimum Speed

column2: 7. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column6: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column8: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 8. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
column6: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
column8: honk your horn and proceed with caution.

column2: 9. To drive defensively, you must:
column6: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.
column8: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 10. When you are driving, turning your head and looking before changing lanes is:
column6: unnecessary, you should use your rearview mirror instead.
column8: a good driving habit.

column2: 11. This sign indicates:
column8: A shared lane

column2: 12. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column6: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column8: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column10: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.

column2: 13. This is:
column8: a merging traffic sign.

column2: 14. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column6: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column10: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.

column2: 15. When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
column4: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.
column6: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.
column8: slow down and adjust their driving manner.

column2: 16. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column8: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column2: 17. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column8: red, green and yellow

column2: 18. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column4: They are hard to see in traffic.
column8: They obey specific traffic laws.

column2: 19. When a pedestrian is crossing a street guided carrying a white cane, drivers must:
column6: help the pedestrian cross the street.
column8: yield the right of way at corners only.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: Cars in right lane must slow down
column8: Pass only in the right lane

column2: 21. Drivers who have been drinking are more likely to:
column8: keep a safe following distance.

column2: 22. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column6: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.
column8: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.

column2: 23. Work zone signs:
column4: mean that drivers must come to a complete stop and back up.
column6: mean that drivers should drive faster to get out of the work zone.
column8: provide information on road work or other temporary road conditions.
column10: mean that road conditions will improve soon.

column2: 24. Two solid yellow lines between lanes of traffic means:
column4: passing is permitted on the left.
column8: the lanes are designed to carry traffic in one direction at certain times and in the opposite direction at other times.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column8: Lane shifting
